title: I dont like to play normals on my own
body:
I want to get better at LoL but I just dont want to play normals alone.

My friend who's been teaching me how to play has done a good job ( im level 20) but I cant play with him often because he's level 30 and I always get afraid im going to feed.

I dont like playing alone because I feel like there's too many try hards that are going to flame me if I feed (thin skinned btw)

Basically what Im saying is I get too afraid to play normals{{item:3070}}

replies.body:
I've had this feeling so many times, you want to play with friends but at the same time you just don't want to let them down by feeding like crazy.  I've been playing LoL since 2013 and although I'm level 30, I still feel like I'm really bad and am one of the weaker players in my friends group.  That said, my friends play LoL for many reasons; its not always about winning. Sometimes my friends are just happy to take a hit on on their chances of winning because they enjoy helping me get better. 

I guess I'm saying don't be too hard on yourself. The journey is a long one which I'm sure others can relate to. If you're like me your confidence will grow the more you play.
Mute people who are negative, or just mute everyone at the start of the game if youre that worried about what they might say. Pings do a good enough job of communicating things most of the time.

> [{quoted}](name=McRuthless,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=jEE1dzoA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-07-13T16:30:21.106+0000)
>
> Mute people who are negative, or just mute everyone at the start of the game if youre that worried about what they might say. Pings do a good enough job of communicating things most of the time.

Usually this isn't the case for me, if the team is communicative with things like "Don't, you need to push your lane so don't gank us yet" or, "Do you want this buff, (insert SPECIFIC name here)?" I'll need to always be looking at chat.

That, and you miss out on all the bombastic personalities around <3

I'll duo norms... norms are for fun/learning so you shouldn't hate someone if someone is doing badly or anything. Just a warning though - I'll probably be playing random stuff and going for a 100% fun factor.

You also learn in ranked, we really need normal draft back.

nobody understands the difference between just playing for fun and not feeding/actually helping your team to win. if you're learning a champs mechanics play bots, if you're still not good with them play some more fucking bots
not intermediate. in at least 3 games theres gonna be someone with a new champ/outright feeds/dc's/is a bot so the game should last at least 25 minutes
I am having the same issue. want to play?

There are almost always going to be people who try to put you down when you do or don't stuff up. Don't mind them focus on playing better. Learn your matchups with your lane, keep an eye on everyone especially the jungler and ward when you have a spare 75 gold. Many many guides out there to help you get better. It helps if you reduce the size of chat in the interface tab of the options (esc). You can enlarge your map there as well so that you're more focused on where everything and everyone are instead of what they're trash talking about.

You shouldn't be afraid to feed in normals. they're there so you can learn and get better. There will be people that do flame you if you give the enemy a few kills, but you should just mute them and continue playing.
